title: Why is electric light important? - Quora

response.answer_text: Electricity is one of the most important blessings that science has given to mankind. It has also become a part of modern life and one cannot think of a world without it. Electricity has many uses in our day to day life. It is used for lighting rooms, working fans and domestic appliances like using electric stoves, A/C and more. All these provide comfort to people. In factories, large machines are worked with the help of electricity. Essential items like food, cloth, paper and many other things are the product of electricity. Modern means of transportation and communication have been revolutionised by it. Electric trains and battery cars are quick means of travel. Electricity also provides means of amusement, radio, television and cinema, which are the most popular forms of entertainment are the result of electricity. Modern equipment like computers and robots have also been developed because of electricity. Electricity plays a pivotal role in the fields of medicines and surgery too — such as X-ray, ECG. The use of electricity is increasing day by day. More helpful to: Importance of electricity If you have any questions, need any help, please go to Rothdesign (in my bio) and contact us for help! Paul

Without light during the night, you won’t be able to see. When you can’t see, you can’t work, you can’t continue on with most of your chores. That would be more than 4 hours lost everyday. Children won’t be able to revise during the night. Or even if the sun is still up, there will be situations where the light in a room isn’t bright enough, which would cause a lot of strain to the eye. Even though you can use candle, electric light is important because it is not dangerous (unlike candles). It won’t set the house on fire if it comes into contact with something that can catch fire. It’s much safer. It doesn’t emit carbon dioxide during operation unlike candles. It doesn’t emit as much heat as candles do. It’s much more efficient than candles. Most of the energy are spent on producing heat energy for candles. Whereas the recent light bulbs can convert most of the electric energy to light.
